project.description:
This job will load data found in the local directory /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_input. The loader will scan the directory, and load all files ending with either a .csv or .sql extension. When this job completes successfully, it will move any existing HPDS phenotype data to a backup directory "/usr/local/docker-config/hpds_bak", and the new data will be placed in "/usr/local/docker-config/hpds/". The "Start PIC-SURE" job needs to be run after this job completes to refresh the HPDS data volume mount and allow PIC-SURE to access the new data.
for SQL data input, each file must contain a single SQL query that returns 5 columns, as described in the CSV header. In addition, you need to create a properties file with your database connection details named /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_input/sql.properties. See https://github.com/hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds/blob/master/docker/pic-sure-hpds-etl/hpds/sql.properties for an example.
For CSV data input, each file must start with a header line, exactly matching this string:
"PATIENT_NUM","CONCEPT_PATH","NVAL_NUM","TVAL_CHAR","TIMESTAMP"
Each subsequent row in the data file or the SQL result must contain the following entries to match the header columns. Please note, sorting the input data by the following column sequence will greatly speed up loading: CONCEPT_PATH,PATIENT_NUM,TIMESTAMP.
PATIENT_NUM: This is an integer value identifying the subject of the recorded observation fact.
CONCEPT_PATH: This is an identifier for the concept of the observation fact. For compatibility with the PIC-SURE UI this path should represent a location in a hierarchy where each level is separated by a backslash and with a leading and trailing backslash, e.g., "\demographics\AGE\". In general this can be any string value, so the UI will display whatever is inside HPDS. If this HPDS instance is part of a PIC-SURE networked environment the same concept paths should be used in all sites involved in the network so that queries can be federated across the network.
NVAL_NUM: A numeric value if this is a numeric concept, otherwise blank.
TVAL_CHAR: A text value if this is a categorical concept, otherwise blank.
TIMESTAMP: A timestamp for the observation fact, this should be expressed as the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT. This is equivalent to the Unix Epoch time value for the time of the observation multiplied by 1000.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
export PROFILING_OPTS="-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=9000 -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=false -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=localhost"
docker stop hpds-etl && docker rm hpds-etl
rm -rf /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp rm -rf /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_bak mkdir -p /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp
#generate a new encryption key openssl enc -aes-128-cbc -k secret -P | grep key | cut -d '=' -f2 > /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp/encryption_key
docker run --name=hpds-etl \ -v /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp:/opt/local/hpds \ -v /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_input/:/opt/local/hpds_input/ \ -e JAVA_OPTS="-Dlogback.log.level=DEBUG" \ -e HEAPSIZE=4096 -e LOADER_NAME=SequentialLoader hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds-etl:LATEST && \ mv /usr/local/docker-config/hpds /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_bak && \ mv /usr/local/docker-config/hpds_temp /usr/local/docker-config/hpds
